intro: Moerenhoutia leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered moerenhoutia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white petals and hairy stems. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun. Moerenhoutia leucantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
